result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: COURT LOWERS CASH BOND TO $5000.

10:44 AM Defendant Nikolas A Harwood in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Nikolas A Harwood. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Case called to address Motion to Modify Bond. 
Atty Nimmer makes arguments on record for lowering the cash bond. 
State objects to any modification of bond for reasons as stated on the record.
Court lowers the bond to $5,000 with the same conditions. 
Defense is still seeking electronic discovery. Court reschedules 9/14 date to allow time for Defense to acquire and review.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Of Judge Michael O. Bohren, filed by Attorney Amanda Nimmer.   

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 1, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:23 AM Defendant Nikolas A Harwood in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Attorney Nimmer files a request for substitution of Judge Michael Bohre.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Clerk's office to schedule a date before the Trial Court once this case has been reassigned to a new Judge.

01:28 PM Defendant Nikolas A Harwood in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that attorney Nimmer was just appointed.
The Court notes that prelim is schedule August 01, 2022 at 9:15 AM.
The Court takes no further action.
Bail remains as fixed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

ADDRESS INFO for Nikolas A Harwood
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 3455 S Raymond Road, New Berlin, WI 53151

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, or their residences.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1/4 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:45 PM Defendant Nikolas A Harwood in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Witness A appeared in Court and presented a statement to the Court.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
